articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Jung Rin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Jung Rin
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of Kim Jung Rin, member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and secretary of the Party Central Committee, on Thursday, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves for Shanghai World Expo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves for Shanghai World Expo
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation headed by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, left here Thursday by special plane to participate in the opening ceremony of the 2010 Shanghai World Expo to be held in China.
					 He was accompanied by members of the delegation Vice-Premier of the Cabinet O Su Yong and Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Song Gi and other suite members.
					
					 The delegation was seen off at the airport by Vice-President of the Presidium of the SPA Yang Hyong Sop, Director of the Secretariat of the Cabinet Kim Yong Ho, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Kil Yon and Hao Xiaofei, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Austrian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Austrian President
Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Heinz Fischer upon his reelection as federal President of Austria.
					Expressing belief that the relations between the DPRK and Austria would grow strong in the common interests, Kim in the message wished the federal President success in his work and good health and happiness.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Indian Ambassador
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Indian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with Pratap Singh, new Indian ambassador e. p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Condolences Expressed over Death of Kim Jung Rin
articles.content:
Condolences Expressed over Death of Kim Jung Rin
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Senior party, army and state officials, the chairpersons of the friendly parties, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and working people visited the bier of Kim Jung Rin, member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and secretary of the WPK Central Committee, Thursday to express deep condolences over his death.
					 Seen by the bier was a wreath sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Wreaths were laid there in the name of the WPK Central Committee and the Presidium of the SPA and the Cabinet of the DPRK, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, party and power organs in Pyongyang, etc.
					
					 The mourners observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jung Rin.
					
					 They also expressed deep condolences to the bereaved family members.
					
					 The diplomatic corps and representatives of international organizations here and overseas Koreans also visited the bier on the same day to express condolences over the death of Kim Jung Rin.

articles.title: Film Show Held at Russian Embassy
articles.content:
Film Show Held at Russian Embassy
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery Sukhinin and Military Attache Alexei Bartusov gave a film show at the embassy on Thursday on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of Russia's victory in the Great Patriotic War.
					 Present there on invitation were Vice-Chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Hong Son Ok who is chairwoman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Staff members of the Russian embassy were on hand.
					
					 The participants watched the Soviet feature film "Liberation".

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Pakistani Delegation Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Pakistani Delegation Held
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with members of a delegation of the Pakistani preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was held Thursday.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation of the said committee headed by advisor to the committee Nisar Ahmed Khuhro, speaker of the Assembly of Sind State of Pakistan, and Muhammad Saeed Khan, councilor of the Pakistani embassy here.
					
					 Present there were members of the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship Association including its Chairman Kil Chol Hyok, secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league.
					
					 The participants talked to one another about the issues of grandly celebrating the centenary of birth of the President and boosting the friendly relations between the DPRK and Pakistan and appreciated an art performance given by schoolchildren.

articles.title: WHO Director-General Leaves
articles.content:
WHO Director-General Leaves
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Margaret Chan, director-general of the World Health Organization, and her party left here Thursday.
					 During their stay in the DPRK they visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, the Ryongsan-ri People's Hospital in Junghwa County, North Hwanghae Province, and other places.

articles.title: Fertilizer Production Process Goes Operational
articles.content:
Fertilizer Production Process Goes Operational
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The fertilizer production process based on anthracite gasification at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex went operational with due ceremony on Thursday.
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Yong Il, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Ki Nam and others and leading officials of party and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and officials, workers, technicians and builders in South Phyongan Province, the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex and relevant industrial establishments.
					
					 A congratulatory message of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent to the builders, technicians and officials who performed feats in the gasification project was conveyed at the ceremony.
					
					 The message said that the completion of the project is a shining victory of President Kim Il Sung's idea of building Juche-oriented industry and the wise guidance of the party as well as a shining product of the inexhaustible mental power of the working people of the DPRK intensely loyal to the party and the leader.
					
					 The completion of the project is a solemn declaration which proved in the eyes of the world that no sanctions of the enemies against the DPRK can block the advance for a great surge being made by the heroic Korean people single-mindedly united around the party, the message said. 
					
					 The WPK Central Committee in the message expressed belief that all the builders, technicians and officials who participated in the gasification project would work fresh miracles and innovations in the production and construction, single-mindedly united around leader Kim Jong Il, bring about a landmark turn in improving the people's standard of living and thus positively contribute to making hurrah for socialism and song of Arirang for prosperity resound throughout the country.
					
					 Ri Mu Yong, minister of Chemical Industry, said in an address that the President unrolled a plan for replacing the process of producing fertilizer with the one of Korean style and that Kim Jong Il set forth a revolutionary policy on putting the country's chemical industry on a Juche basis and developing it on a higher stage and has energetically led the work to put them into practice.
					
					 The reporter called on the working people in Namhung to effect a great surge in the production of fertilizer and chemical goods and thus put spurs to the development of light industry and agriculture and contribute to improving the people's standard of living. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.

articles.title: Officials Visit New Fertilizer Production Process
articles.content:
Officials Visit New Fertilizer Production Process
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials and leading officials of party and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions and relevant industrial establishments Thursday visited the process for producing fertilizer through the anthracite gasification at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex.
					 After being briefed on the complex, the visitors went round the newly built gas purification process, gas generation process, fertilizer forwarding site and other places.
					
					 The visit provided them with an opportunity to deeply grasp the clairvoyant far-sightedness of President Kim Il Sung who unrolled a far-reaching plan for putting the fertilizer production on a Juche basis in reliance upon the raw and other materials abundant in the DPRK.
					
					 They expressed deep admiration at the might of the self-supporting national economy, watching fertilizer being churned out in an endless stream from the production processes based on the anthracite gasification suited to the actual conditions of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: "Orchestra of the 21st Century" Gives Performance
articles.content:
"Orchestra of the 21st Century" Gives Performance
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The "Orchestra of the 21st Century" of Russia gave its performance Thursday. 
					 It was enjoyed by artistes and pressmen in the fields of literature and arts and media and students.
					
					 The orchestra put on the stage such colorful numbers as chorus and orchestral music "Where Are You, Comrade-in-Arms Now", male solo and chorus "Tribute to That Great Period" and male trio "Song of Three Tankmen".
					
					 The Russian artistes in their chorus "Where Are You, Dear General" successfully represented the noble ideological and moral world of the army and people of the DPRK absolutely trusting and following their leader.

articles.title: "Among the People" Vol. 87 Published
articles.content:
"Among the People" Vol. 87 Published 
						
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House published collection of reminiscences "Among the People" Vol. 87.
					 The book contains 19 reminiscences telling stories that President Kim Il Sung ceaselessly visited factories and farms, leading working people to work miracles and innovations and took warm care of revolutionary soldiers one by one and put them forward, showing deep loving care for them.
					
					 Reminiscences "Personally Ascertaining Revolutionary Relics" and "Helping Steadfastly Inherit the Soul of Revolutionary Forerunners" deal with the facts that the President visited the Korean Revolution Museum and gave valuable teachings, ascertaining revolutionary relics dating back to the period of revolutionary activities in his early years for a long while and that he led bereaved children of revolutionary martyrs to creditably carry forward the traditions of Mt. Paektu just as the revolutionaries of the first generation did.
					
					 Reminiscences "Story to Be Conveyed Long with Nyongwon Power Station" and "Visiting Newly Built Knitting Mill" tell stories that the President visited Nyongwon to personally choose the site for a dam and exerted efforts for the construction of the power station and that he went round the newly built Wonsan Knitting Mill, indicating the way for it to follow, and helped the Korean women to become heroines and creators of the era.
					
					 The book also contains reminiscences telling about the personality of the President as a great man and his noble virtues.

articles.title: Agro-scientific Achievements Made
articles.content:
Agro-scientific Achievements Made
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Academy of Agricultural Science of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has gained many successes in researches necessary for farming. 
					 The Institute of Agricultural Mechanization has made a motor-driven fertilizing machine with furrowing, fertilizing and soil-covering devices.
					
					 The machine has already been introduced in co-op farms to prove a good result in fertilization and crop harvest.
					
					 The Institute of Agricultural Chemicalization has developed a new kind of highly concentrated compound fertilizer for bean seeds.
					
					 The fertilizer, which includes 12 nutritive elements, including sulphur bacteria, makes it possible to sharply increase bean production per hectare while reducing the production cost 60-70 percent compared with the existing one.
					
					 The Institute of Plant Preservation Science has classified the species of parasitic bees and put their eclosion on a scientific basis, thus paving a way for stamping out walking sticks.
					
					 The Veterinary Institute has made a fresh mixed vaccine for simultaneously preventing swine erysipelas and streptococcal disease.
					
					 The vaccine is well accepted by pig farms across the country.

articles.title: Proliferation of Aquatic Resources Encouraged
articles.content:
Proliferation of Aquatic Resources Encouraged 
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has channeled great efforts into protection and proliferation of aquatic resources.
					 After setting April and July as months for protection of marine resources, the government has strengthened state supervision and control of this work.
					
					 Fishery stations have improved living conditions of fishes, while fish farms have stocked breeding ponds with fries and little shellfishes.
					
					 Fishing except angling is not allowed in special reserves of aquatic resources, lakes, reservoirs and rivers and such fishes of rare species as Hucho ishikawai, urrmchy, burbot, terrapin and rainbow trout are under strict protection.
					
					 Successes have also been made in hatching sea cucumber, abalone, scallop, sea urchin and large clam.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Branch Academy of Fishery, based on its achievement in the artificial proliferation of salmon, has intensified research into raising its survival and reproduction rate.

articles.title: GFTUK Denounces S. Korea for Blocking May 1 Event
articles.content:
GFTUK Denounces S. Korea for Blocking May 1 Event
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea issued a statement on Thursday denouncing the south Korean conservative group for having blocked the May 1 reunification event of workers in the north and the south of Korea.
					 The south Korean conservative group including the puppet Ministry of Unification disallowed the south side delegation's participation in the event just before the working contact in Kaesong between workers' organizations of the north and the south aimed at finally examining the preparations for the event, whiling away time under the unreasonable pretext of "people's sentiment" and thereby torpedoing the event, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The above-said action taken by the puppet group is a blatant challenge to the unanimous aspiration and desire of the workers and all other fellow countrymen for national reconciliation, unity and reunification and another treacherous anti-reunification provocation to overturn the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 The group of traitors scuttled the event because it was afraid of the meeting of workers in the north and the south strongly desirous of reunification and felt fearful of the mindset of the south Korean people to judge its acts of treachery.
					
					 The reality proves once again that democracy of the south Korean society, national concord and independent reunification can never be achieved but only storms of confrontation and war will rage on this land as long as the puppet conservative group is allowed to desperately pursue confrontation with fellow countrymen, paying no heed to the mindset of the people.
					
					 The reunification event has been torpedoed due to the unreasonable obstructions of the south Korean conservative group but with nothing can it break the firm will of all the fellow countrymen to implement the historic June 15 joint declaration, meet the challenge of the anti-reunification forces and achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity.

articles.title: White Paper Released on S. Korean Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
White Paper Released on S. Korean Human Rights Abuses
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The National Reunification Institute released a white paper Thursday indicting the fascist clique for having reduced south Korea to the land with the worst human rights record through sycophancy and treachery, fascist dictatorship and confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					 The white paper said:
					
					 It is the most hideous human rights abuses committed by the fascist clique that it forced south Koreans to fall victim to outsiders' domination and war policies and wantonly violated their human rights.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggression forces' more than six decade-long presence in south Korea is the crime-woven history with aggression, war, massacre, plunder and human rights abuses.
					
					 The results of "the inspection of state administration" submitted to the puppet National Assembly disclosed that the U.S. imperialist aggression troops in south Korea committed hundreds of crimes of all forms on an annual average and such high-profile crimes as murder, robbery, rape and blow accounted for 60 percent of them.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggression forces occupy vast areas extending more than 73.2 million phyong in over 100 regions of south Korea at present. If the areas around their bases are polluted, they move to other areas, grabbing a large area of land and turning it barren.
					
					 The puppet group of traitors imported American beef seriously harming the health and life security of south Koreans and touching off outcries among them. This is the hideous human rights abuse of special mention.
					
					The group introduced to south Korea more than 1,000 U.S. nukes enough to destroy the Korean nation dozens or hundreds of times. It, however, has persistently taken issue with the DPRK's nuclear deterrent, while zealously shielding and conniving at the U.S. nukes which may inflict a nuclear holocaust upon the fellow countrymen.
					
					 It is also staging together with the U.S. the dangerous nuclear war exercises against the fellow countrymen in a bid to force Koreans to fall victim to a nuclear war to be launched by its master.
					
					 It is, at the same time, hurling young and middle-aged Koreans to the shambles of wars of aggression being waged by the U.S. in different parts of the world, forcing them to meet grievous deaths.
					
					 It is another hideous human rights abuse committed by the puppet group that it revived fascist dictatorship and turned south Korea into a tundra of human rights where democracy is cruelly violated.
					
					 Talking about "the lost decade", the group trampled down even sprouts of democracy won in the days of the preceding regime and drastically reinforced repressive machines and comprehensively revived all kinds of fascist laws and systems.
					
					 There occurred unprecedented tragic incidents last year in which the two former "presidents" met unnatural deaths due to the fascist authorities' despicable politically-motivated harassment and retaliation. This clearly indicates what a deplorable phase the human rights performance has reached in south Korea.
					
					 The number of the political parties and organizations that were labeled "illegal organizations" by the authorities since the conservative group's seizure of power reached more than 1 840.
					
					 Politically-motivated investigation and surveillances are openly carried out and crackdown upon media is throwing people into consternation.
					
					 The south Koreans' freedom of assembly, demonstration and association are ruthlessly violated and torture, violence and inhuman insults are rampant.
					
					The cases of human rights abuses committed by prosecution and police and in prisons, etc. numbered more than 3,490 out of over 5,000 cases reported to the puppet Human Rights Committee in 2008, accounting for nearly 70 percent of all reported cases.
					
					 After its seizure of power the puppet group adopted anti-reunification and confrontation with fellow countrymen as a policy toward the DPRK and totally violated the north-south joint declarations reflecting the unanimous wishes of all Koreans. It has stepped up the moves for a nuclear war against the DPRK and kicked up smear human rights campaigns, pushing the north-south relations to a catastrophe. This only brought into bolder relief its true colors as a heinous human rights abuser.
					
					 It is busy whipping together all types of human scum and riff-raffs in a bid to escalate confrontation with the DPRK and false propaganda against it.
					
					 The group is getting frantic with the operations to lure and kidnap compatriots.
					
					 Any activities for relations with the north and for reunification are labeled "enemy-benefiting ones" and suppressed and dialogue, contacts and cooperation between people of all strata and NGOs of the north and the south have been blocked since the puppet group came to power. 
					
					 The puppet conservative group will never be allowed to go scot-free for committing such human rights abuses as turning south Korea into the worst tundra of human rights but will certainly face a stern punishment by the nation.

articles.title: KCNA Report on Completion of Fertilizer Production Process
articles.content:
KCNA Report on Completion of Fertilizer Production Process
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency released a report on Thursday in connection with the fact that ultra-modern large-scale anthracite gasification process was completed at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, a comprehensive chemical base in the DPRK, making it possible to produce fertilizer with the locally available natural resources.
					 According to the report, the officials and designers of the Namhung Chemical Designing Institute worked out the overall processes Korean way in reliance upon the locally available raw materials and the industrial foundation of the DPRK.
					
					 The workers of the complex not only completed in a matter of little over one year the huge construction project which would have taken several years at an ordinary pace but made achievements in the manufacture and assembly of equipment and facilities.
					
					 The scientists and technicians succeeded in producing ammonia synthetic catalyst through anthracite gasification with their own technology and introduced the latest scientific and technological achievements to suit the specific conditions of the country.
					
					 They also developed control programs according to the specific features of such processes as gas generation process and ammonia production process to suit the actual conditions of the complex on the principle of profitability, thus establishing the computer control system of Korean style equipped with automatic control, sequential control, warning and break system and self-checkup functions.
					
					 The development of indigenous DCS system in putting chemical industry on an automatic control opened up a bright prospect of establishing an integrated computer control system in comprehensive large chemical bases of the country.
					
					 The completion of the anthracite gasification also made it possible to remarkably increase the fertilizer production while cutting down the production cost more than two times as compared with the method of producing ammonia by naphtha. This also helps put spurs to the development of petrochemical industry. 
					
					 The completion of the anthracite gasification opened up a bright prospect of drastically developing agriculture and bringing about a decisive turn in improving the people's standard of living.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Songun Politics
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Songun Politics
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- It is entirely thanks to the Songun politics pursued by the Workers' Party of Korea that peace has been preserved on this land and the dignity and security of the nation have been reliably defended under the present tense and acute situation, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a signed article.
					 Neither independent reunification so much desired by all the Koreans and peace and prosperity nor the destiny of individual Koreans would have been thinkable without the Songun politics, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Korean nation which once lamented over its sorrow as a weak nation downtrodden by outsiders is now powerfully demonstrating its dignity and honor as a strong nation in the world.  This stirring reality of the DPRK clearly indicates that the dignity and independent development of the nation are all guaranteed by Songun.
					
					 Peace has been firmly defended on the Korean Peninsula today when the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers' moves for provoking a nuclear war have reached an extreme phase. This hard reality once again proves it was entirely just for the DPRK to have bolstered up its national capability for self-defence in every way under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 The Songun politics helps decisively foil with matchless force the reckless military provocations of the foreign aggressors who are dead-set against the reunification of Korea and the south Korean conservative ruling forces, their lackeys, and, at the same time, instills great national pride and self-esteem into the Koreans, positively encouraging them in their struggle for sovereignty.
					
					 The Songun politics firmly protects and safeguards not only the people in the DPRK but people of all social strata in south Korea.
					
					 Immensely rosy and bright is the future of the Korean nation as long as the great Songun politics is in force in reliance upon the invincible revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 Whoever has the blood and soul of the Korean nation should feel greatly honored and proud of the Songun politics of the WPK, a great banner of the nation, and uphold it with single-minded patriotism, regardless of whether he or she lives in the north or the south or overseas, the article concludes.

articles.title: Disbandment of Puppet Prosecution Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Disbandment of Puppet Prosecution Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea made public a statement on April 24 denouncing the irregularities and corruption of the puppet prosecution.
					 The statement referred to the fact that the prosecution's patronage of sex traffic was brought to light by a press report some time ago.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the authorities appointed the man involved in the crime as head of the "committee for probing the truth" behind the case in a bid to cover up the truth, the statement deplored, and went on:
					
					 Nothing can hide the despicable nature of the prosecution which has so far acted a servant for those in power, dictating the people.
					
					 Not a few democratic figures lost their lives due to the prosecution hell-bent on irregularities and corruption and there took place such shocking incident as driving a former "president" into a suicide. 
					
					 The recently disclosed fact lashed all the people into fury, the statement noted, demanding that the corrupt prosecution threatening the people and protecting the dictatorial power be disbanded.

articles.title: Meeting of Chongryon Officials and Koreans in Japan Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Chongryon Officials and Koreans in Japan Held
Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- A meeting of officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan was held in Tokyo on April 27 to extend thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for having remitted educational aid fund and stipends for the democratic national education of the children of Koreans in Japan.
					 Present there were Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, Nam Sung U, its vice-chairman, and others.
					
					 Jo Han Ju, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Teachers and School Clerks in Japan, in a report made at the meeting extended the highest glory and the warmest thanks to Kim Jong Il for having continuously sent educational aid fund and stipends for the development of the democratic national education of Chongryon true to the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He recalled that Kim Jong Il ceaselessly sent educational aid fund and stipends even during the "Arduous March", the forced march and repeatedly indicated important guidelines to be held fast to in the field of national education.
					
					 He called upon all the educational workers of Chongryon to turn out in the drive to further glorify the national education as the lifeline of the movement of the Koreans in Japan and as a bulwark for preserving and carrying forward the national identity of the Korean community in Japan.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 A message of thanks to Kim Jong Il was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show Held in China
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show Held in China
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- A Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia show was held in China on April 23 and 24.
					 The show was visited by many executives of Chinese companies in Liaoning and Dandong and other companies and Chinese from all walks of life, Koreans in China and foreign guests in China including Americans, Dutch, Russians and Britons.
					
					 The visitors expressed profound admiration at the beautiful and mysterious looks of flowers of the sun, immortal flowers in full bloom in praise of the exploits of the peerlessly great men. Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia are, indeed, peculiar flowers and they are really beautiful and marvelous, they added.

articles.title: Memorandum of DPRK FM Supported in Switzerland
articles.content:
Memorandum of DPRK FM Supported in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Switzerland issued a joint statement on April 22 in support of the memorandum released by the DPRK Foreign Ministry.
					 The statement introduced in detail the contents of the memorandum, noting that all the facts clearly show who was the first to deploy nuclear weapons on the Korean Peninsula and who is threatening others.
					
					 The DPRK has striven to defuse the U.S. nuclear threat by means of building a nuclear-free zone through dialogue and negotiations, it said, adding:
					
					 The U.S., however, turned down all the proposals and initiatives of the DPRK.
					
					 This compelled the DPRK to develop its own nuclear weapons for self-defence.
					
					 The DPRK successfully conducted a nuclear test in October of 2006 and in May of 2009.
					
					 This put an end to the nuclear imbalance in Northeast Asia where only the DPRK was left without any nuke.
					
					 The DPRK will not use its nuclear weapons against non-nuclear states or threaten them with nukes as long as they do not join nuclear weapons states in invading or attacking it.
					
					 The DPRK will continue to support the international efforts for nuclear non-proliferation and nuclear disarmament.
					
					 To have fair talks with the DPRK or not entirely depends upon the U.S.
					
					 The statement demanded the U.S. stop at once its nuclear threat to the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked in Various Countries
Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings, meetings, lectures, photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Brazil, Finland, Italy, Uganda and Libya between April 14 and 20 on the occasions of the Day of the Sun, the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the 78th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 Displayed in the venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their undying exploits and books and photos introducing the invincible might of Songun Korea and the efforts of the Korean people to build a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 Speeches were made at the functions.
					
					 Jose Gil de Almeida, chairman of the Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK, said that Kim Il Sung was an outstanding leader who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation, adding that the cause of building a thriving nation in the DPRK has been successfully carried forward and accomplished by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Juha Kieksy, chairman of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, stressed that the great exploits performed by Kim Il Sung for the Korean and world revolution would always be remembered by progressive mankind.
					
					 Miriam Pelegrini Feri, president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy, said that thanks to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il and the invincible KPA, the future of the DPRK is in safe hands. 
					
					 The acting executive secretary of the Ugandan National Women's Council said President Kim Il Sung was as great as the sun, praising the immortal exploits of the President boundlessly revered by all people.
					
					 The participants of the film shows watched Korean films including "Reply of Korea".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il expresa condolencias por el fallecimiento de Kim Jung Rin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il expresa condolencias por el fallecimiento de Kim Jung Rin
  Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente  Kim Jong Il envio el dia 29 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kim Jung Rin, miembro del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y secretario del CC del PTC, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de "Orquesta del Siglo 21" de Rusia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de "Orquesta del Siglo 21" de Rusia
						
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, presencio el dia 28 la funcion de la "Orquesta del Siglo 21" de Rusia, de visita en Corea.
					La banda esta integrada por los actores del pueblo y benemeritos, los ganadores de concursos internacionales y otros famosos directores, vocalistas y ejecutantes de Rusia.
					
					En el repertorio de ese dia estuvieron los programas de diferentes generos como el coro y musica orquestal "?Donde estas ahora, mi companero de armas?", el trio masculino "Llego la hora de partir", el solo masculino y coro "Tributo a aquella epoca grandiosa", el coro y danza "Kalinka", el solo masculino "?En donde comienza la patria?", el solo femenino "Panuelo azul", el solo folclorico femenino "Sauce", el coro y solo de acordeon cromatico "En el bosque cercano al frente", el solo de violin "Chardash", el coro "Dia de la Victoria" y las canciones coreanas "?Donde esta el querido General?", "Mi tierra natal", etc.
					
					En la ocasion los ejecutantes demostraron bien con su gran habilidad artistica el calido patriotismo, las costumbres tradicionales de vida y la idiosincrasia del pueblo ruso.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il les mando un cesto de flores para felicitar sus exitos de la representacion.
					
					La disfrutaron junto con el Dirigente los secretarios del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam, los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek y Kim Yong Il, el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju y otros cuadros directivos y los funcionarios de las ramas de cultura y arte, prensa e informacion.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang delegacion coreana a exposicion de Shanghai
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang delegacion coreana a exposicion de Shanghai
						
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- La delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Nam, salio el dia 29 por avion especial de esta capital para asistir a la ceremonia inaugural de la Exposicion Mundial de Shanghai 2010 que tendra lugar en China.
					Partieron junto con Kim Yong Nam el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros O Su Yong, el vicecanciller Kim Song Gi y otros acompanantes.
					
					En el aeropuerto la despidieron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS, Yang Hyong Sop, el jefe del Secretariado del Consejo de Ministros, Kim Yong Ho, el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon y el encargado de negocios a.i. de China en Corea, Hao Xiaofei.

articles.title: FGSC critica la desautorizacion al acto de reunificacion por 1o de mayo
articles.content:
FGSC critica la desautorizacion al acto de reunificacion por 1o de mayo
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- El Comite Central de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea (FGSC) hizo publica el dia 29 una declaracion para denunciar las maniobras criminales de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos que impidio el acto de reunificacion por el Primero de Mayo planeado por los obreros de ambas partes coreanas.
					Esa camarilla, inclusive el titere Ministerio de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea, que recurria a la tactica dilatoria hablando del "sentimiento del pueblo" y otros pretextos injustos, desautorizo a ultima hora la participacion de la delegacion surcoreana en dicho acto presentandose hasta en el contacto de trabajo de las entidades obreras Norte-Sur que se celebraba en Kaesong para ultimar los preparativos del particular, senala la nota y continua:
					
					Esta conducta resulta desafio frontal a la unanime aspiracion y anhelo de los obreros y de toda la nacion sobre la reconciliacion, la unidad y la reunificacion de la nacion y otra provocacion antinacional y anti-reunificacion para echar por tierra la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio. 
					
					Los traidores surcoreanos impidieron el acto del Primero de Mayo para la reunificacion porque tienen miedo al encuentro entre los obreros del Norte y el Sur, llenos del entusiasmo por reunificar la patria, y a la opinion publica surcoreana que se inclina a castigar sus crimenes antinacionales y vendepatrias.
					
					 La realidad vuelve a evidenciar que mientras se deja intacta a la banda de conservadores titeres que esta obsesionada por la confrontacion fratricida haciendo vista gorda de la voluntad del pueblo, no se puede lograr nunca la democratizacion de la sociedad surcoreana ni la unidad nacional ni la reunificacion independiente, al contrario, se cernira en la tierra patria el nubarron de confrontacion y guerra. 
					
					Aunque ha sido imposible el encuentro por la reunificacion de las entidades obreras Norte-Sur debido al injusto proceder de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos, no sera doblegada jamas la firme voluntad de toda la nacion coreana de ejecutar la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y lograr la reunificacion independiente, la paz y la prosperidad frustrando los desafios de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion.

articles.title: Cuadros visitan Complejo Quimico Juventud de Namhung
articles.content:
Cuadros visitan Complejo Quimico Juventud de Namhung
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- Los cuadros del partido y el Estado y los funcionarios directivos de los organos del partido y el Poder, entidades de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, fabricas y empresas de ramas relacionadas visitaron el dia 29 los procesos de produccion de abonos segun la gasificacion de antracita del Complejo Quimico Juventud de Namhung. 
					  Tras escuchar las explicaciones generales, los visitantes recorrieron el proceso de purificacion de gas, el de formacion de carbon en vara, el de generacion de gas, el lugar de expedicion de abonos, etc.
					
					  A traves de esta visita, ellos se dieron cuenta de la prevision clarividente del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien presento el gran proposito de jucheanizar la produccion de abonos ateniendose a las materias primas criollas que abundan.
					
					Al ver que bajo la direccion del Dirigente       Kim Jong Il tales procesos de abonos se construyeron conforme a la realidad de Corea y se producen en avalancha los abonos, quedaron maravillados por el poderio de la economia nacional independiente.

articles.title: Fallecio Kim Jung Rin
articles.content:
Fallecio Kim Jung Rin
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- El miembro del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Jung Rin, fallecio el dia 28 a los 86 anos de edad a causa del infarto de miocardio.
					  El nacio el 7 de diciembre del 12 (1923) de la Era Juche en una familia campesina pobre del distrito de Usi de la provincia de Jagang.  
					
					Despues de la liberacion de la patria (1945), crecio como funcionario talentoso en el regazo del Presidente Kim Il Sung y lucho abnegadamente por el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					  Trabajo con abnegacion por el fortalecimiento del partido y las filas revolucionarias y por la victoria de la causa revolucionaria del Juche fungiendo durante varios anos como secretario despues de ocupar desde 1952 varios cargos en el CC del PTC como funcionario, jefe de seccion, subjefe y jefe de departamento.
					
					  Tambien trabajo largo tiempo como miembro del organo directivo del CC del PTC desde que fuera elegido en 1961 como miembro suplente del CC del PTC y actuo de diputado a la APS desde la tercera legislatura de este organo legislativo celebrada en 1962.
					
					  En reconocimiento de sus meritos realizados por el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo, se le fueron otorgadas numerosas condecoraciones estatales, incluyendo la Orden Kim Il Sung, maxima distincion de la RPDC, y la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase.
					
					  Ese dia, fue publicada la esquela mortuoria a nombre comun del CC del PTC y el Presidium de la APS de la RPDC.
					
					  La nota senala que Kim Jung Rin dedico toda su inteligencia y pasion a la lucha por fortalecer el PTC en lo organizativo e ideologico, consolidar firmemente la unidad monolitica del partido y las masas, lograr la reunificacion de la patria y buscar la mayor solidaridad internacional con la revolucion coreana apoyando desde hace mucho tiempo la orientacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Destaca que seran eternas sus proezas realizadas ante el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					  El CC del PTC y el Presidium de la APS de la RPDC anunciaron que los funerales del difunto Kim Jung Rin se realizaran con honores del Estado y compusieron la comision funeraria estatal presidida por Jon Pyong Ho e integrada por Kim Yong Il, Kim Yong Chun, Ri Yong Mu y otros 37 miembros.
					
					  Esta comision informo que el feretro del difunto reposa en el Club de Sojang del capitalino municipio de Pothonggang y que recibiria desde las 10 hasta las 20 del dia 29 a los que vienen a despedirse del difunto.
					
					  Agrego que a las 8 del dia 30, el feretro saldra de ese lugar para el entierro.
